**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**: Feature request

/kind feature

In [kube-aws](https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/kube-aws/), we have a feature that handles node draining in response to instances being replaced by the Auto Scaling Group; this works by detecting the node is about to be terminated, and running `kubectl drain --force --ignore-daemonsets --delete-local-data <node>` in response. This node draining request is currently sent on behalf of the node itself, which conform to the group/username restrictions documented [here](https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/admission-controllers/#noderestriction) (assuming TLS bootstrapping feature is enabled in kube-aws).

In Kubernetes 1.7, however, if I enable the NodeRestriction admission controller, this node draining mechanism no longer works because [access to `pods/eviction` sub-resource is denied](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/c8c4fff8be1c1da08a6dec37f8aee44e2a426456/plugin/pkg/admission/noderestriction/admission.go#L106).

What would be the problem of admitting pod eviction requests for pods bound to the node who's making the request? What do you guys think?

/cc @mumoshu  @redbaron
